discussion.content: AC is correct, B is gateway IP, D is session ID not policy ID.

AC should be correct , if you see the source port of the packet , it is an answer from 62.x.x.x
then the Flag is [S.] are Syn Set and ACK set.

as last the packet will be routed by port 3 ( Answer C)

Answer A is correct. Flag [S] means SYN flag is raised. Thus, first interpretation, it is a SYN or SYN/ACK packet. As the session already exists (msg="find an existing session") => it is a SYN/ACK packet. (If the msg= "allocate new session" => SYN packet)
Answer C is correct. last line in the debug flow "find a route ... via port3")

FW received TCP SYN from a client and if connection is allowed FW will send SYN/ACK to the client, therefore answer "A" definitely is not correct and "D" is session ID not policy ID.
Answer: BC

choices.A: FortiGate received a TCP SYN/ACK packet.
choices.B: The source IP address of the packet was translated to 10.0.1.10.
choices.C: FortiGate routed the packet through port 3.
choices.D: The packet was allowed by the firewall policy with the ID 00007fc0.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is configuring an Ipsec between site A and siteB. The Remotes Gateway setting in both sites has been configured as Static IP Address. For site
A, the local quick mode selector is 192.16.1.0/24 and the remote quick mode selector is 192.16.2.0/24. How must the administrator configure the local quick mode selector for site B?

discussion.content: Answer A should Be to detect! Not delete

A & C - Because: When NAT-T is enabled on both ends, peers can detect any NAT device along the path. If NAT is found, then the following occurs:
- Both phase 2 and remaining phase 1 packets change to UDP port 4500.
- Both ends encapsulate ESP within UDP port 4500.
A & C - https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD48755
Answer is B&C

Network Address Translation-Traversal (NAT-T) is a method for getting around IP address translation issues encountered when data protected by IPsec passes through a NAT device for address translation. ... NAT-T encapsulates both IKE and ESP traffic within UDP with port 4500 used as both the source and destination port.
B & C i think

questions.question_text: Which of the following are purposes of NAT traversal in IPsec? (Choose two.)

choices.C: To encapsulation ESP packets in UDP packets using port 4500.
choices.D: To force a new DH exchange with each phase 2 rekey.
choices.B: To dynamically change phase 1 negotiation mode aggressive mode.
choices.A: To delete intermediary NAT devices in the tunnel path.
